text: Nice foggy brown with ample head. Sweet banana dominates, some wheatand maybe hint of plum. A bit light at first then lots of banana and a dry bran/rye bready finish. Really flavorful, balanced, big wheaty finish, mid carbonation. Have to say I like it a lot. Next to Weihenstephaner its one of the best I can remember.

From old tasting notes. Cloudy orange, brown color. Big bubbly beige head. Tart fruity wheat maltiness is yeasty and plum-like. Zesty wheat malt flavor has an underlying sweet fruitiness that hints at lemon peel.

500ml bottle. Best by September of 2017. Pours a clear amber hue with a creamy light beige head. Aroma of banana and spices. Taste is banana, clove, spice, caramel, nuts. Moderate to heavy carbonation. Creamy texture. Quite enjoyable.

Sampled from a 16.0 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very dark brown color with a huge creamy beige head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was dryish with bread crust, a touch of egg white and faint cherry. The flavor was slightly tart with cherry, citrus, yeast, toffee and bread crust. Long finish. Medium body. Solid.

Pours a dark bourbon with a healthy light caramel colored head. Nice caramelly nose. A bit gassy. The flavor, while some caramel malt is noted, is invaded by clove; not terribly, but enough to screw it up completely.
From a 50 cl bottle. Pours a hazy mahogany with a tan head, Aroma of toffee. Tastes of moderately sweet caramel. Smooth finish. Tasty.

Slightly hazy deep chestnut amber with a light tan head. Lovely biscuity nose thats nutty and semisweet and very gently touched with chocolate. Semisweet chocolaty flavor as well with a stern wheaty and biscuity undertone thats large and in charge. Unfair to call it an undertone really. Slight cola note in there.

Bottle. Sometimes, its where you have a beer that matters. Im sitting in the Walburg Biergarten in Walburg, TX, as the sun goes down after a hundred degree day, listening to Tex-Deutsch country music and enjoying this beer. And its pretty damned good.

Originally rated on 9/5/08. Drank this one with the Weihenstephaner yesterday and have to say i prefered the Echter. It pours a deep murky brown body, some yeast flake floaters were present. Nice light brown head. Mouthfeel was creamy and smooth. Flavors evolved as it warmed but banana, clove, roasted nuts and sweet malts blended well together. A pretty good beer that i would purchase again.

500 ml bottle with a BB date stamp of Feb. 2016 poured into a lager glass.

A - Pours cloudy, very dark mahogany in color, with a generous and persistent tan head. 

Aroma: Sweet aroma of banana, dark bread and light spices. 

Flavor - mild, with banana, wheat, sweet caramel malt, light clove. About equally bitter and sweet.

Feel - lively high carbonation seems too high. Light body. 

Overall: lively and refreshing.

Dark burnt Carmel color with thick white head. Spiced banana bread, hint of coriander, possible smoke on the nossle. Pallet replicates it nose with a smidgen of sour on the finish. Light to medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Pours a murky brown with big head that lingers. The flavor is almost like a Belgian beer with lots of clove and banana. It has a mildly sour aftertaste that dissipates quickly. Pretty good overall.

Julius Echter Hefe-Weiss Dunkel has a very thick, mauve head, an initially clear, fiercely-bubbly, rust-brown appearance, and heavy lacing globs left on the glass. The beer clouds up, once the caked sediment is swished loose and poured in. The aroma is of spiced bread, prunes, banana, and banana cream pie. Taste is of those elements, with no bitterness factor, but some acidity showing up. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Julius Echter Hefe-Weiss Dunkel finishes drinkable and on the dry side. RJT
Banana and spice aroma. A beer bottle brown colored body. Wit a mild tan head that lingers a long time. Taste has a mix of banana, yeast and sweet malt. Refreshing. This is a winner.

Full amber body with a poofy, overflowing, off-white head. Liquid bread aroma, enticing German yeastiness with feintness of bananas and even more subtle clove, accenting the multi-grain backbone with a splendid aromatic complexity. Likewise, the first sip is a delicious, filling, and fulfilling one of liquid bread. Complex, multi-grain flavor with some caramel, wheat, and Pilsen malts. Touches of banana and clove, and eventually, even some chocolate. All wrapped together with a perfect wheaty tartness on the finish. Thick,complex and substantive from the first to last sip
Bottle from Specs - Memorial in Houston, TX. Cloudy brown-amber pour with a cream-white head. Aroma of overripe banana, wheat, mild light fruit. Medium palate. Pretty darn good.

Look - Thick head if poured aggressively. Thick bubbles and not retained. Dirty ivory as opposed to tan. The color is unique. It is lighter than a brown ale. It had a red tint too.

Smell - Malt. Brown sugar. Wheat/grass. Sour. Faint chocolate. 

Taste - Malt. Sour. Sweet and sour. I am not sure where the alcohol is. 

Feel - Very carbonated in the throat. Creamy until swallowed. Heavier than other wheat beers.

Overall - This is one of the first dark beers I liked. It pulled me away from wheats and in to stouts. I really like this beer.

Bottle. Fairly clear reddish brown with a thick off white head. Pleasant ripe banana and burnt sugars, perhaps a bit sweet but I really like the caramel in this one. Makes me realize that I havent had a really good dunkelweizen in quite a while, very satisfying.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: New to this style, I really enjoy wiezenbock so had to try. Deep amber/light-brown pour with off-white sticky head - looks great! Aroma of ripened fruit, yeast, and some wheaty malt. Flavors are mostly the same - not a bad thing - with a touch of sweetness. Finish is a bit dry as the flavor quickly fades.

Another old bottle that just showed up at one of my local liquor stores. Sigh. I shouldve checked the bottle dates before purchasing. Best by 2012! Ouch. It pours a very dark amber red color with a nice khaki head. The aroma has some light cherry cola, wheat and stale bread. A little cider. The flavor is a little better with some rich bread, bread crust, mild watery cola, and some light plum notes. Not as bad as the old Hefeweizen I had from them. Its too bad they let this stuff out into market so old.
Pours dark amber color with medium white head. Nose is rosted malts. Aromas are roasted malts, chocolate and ashes. Light body, medium cabronation. Short roasty and sweet finish. Quite watery.

500 ml bottle. Unclear dark amber body with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of dark, light roasted malt, some caramel, fruit and banana. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, mild roasted, yeast, banana and some clove. Medium body and average aftertaste. Nice and refreshing, even on the sweeter side.

Bottle pours a dark clear Amber/brown with s large beige head. Aroma of caramel malt, slightly cidery, light banana and clove, with wheat. Taste similar to aroma, light well balanced flavors. Not bad.

500 ml bottle at home from notes. Pours a hazy amber brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have mild roast, banana, cloves, chocolate, caramel, mild citrus notes with a hint of apple, decent enough for what it is.

Julius Echter Hefe-Weissbier Dunkel is not enough of a Hefe or Dunkel to make it interesting. Nice yeast aroma coming off this dark pour with a nice thick head. Taste has a nice yeast character but none of the notes you might be looking for in a Hefe. No dark beer notes either. Still, a decent brew especially with a meal.

Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate chocolate, light banana, roasted grains, and a hint of apple. It pours hazy/cloudy brown with an orange glow around the edges of the glass. It has a large khaki head with good retention before eventually fading to a thick film. There are some thick soapy rings left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with some light caramel and chocolate. There is some light banana in the middle along with a touch of apple. The finish has light roasted grains with a hint of nuts. Its medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
caramel, bread, hay, toast, roasty, nuts, citrus, floral, dough, banana, red, rocky head, tan foam, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, fizzy,

Pours a dark amber color with a lot of carbonation. There is a white fizzy head that is lasting and left lots of lacing. The aroma is sweet and earthy. Taste is sweet malts, caramel, very minimal bitterness. This beer is definitely worth a try.

Dark orange in the light, maple leaf brown in the dark. Tons of carbonation; a still, unwavering head at the top.

The aroma is candi sugars; a tart yeast component. No banana, but some juicy citruses, like orange rind and tangerine. Homemade bread in the upper nasal cavity. Hint of sugary bubblegum. A definite cellar funk. A handful of purple concord grapes.

Flavor is earthy yeast, with more pink bubblegum. A tart stone fruit on the back of the tongue: a plum, methinks. Slight cherry cough drop. Slight grassy complexion, but quickly gives way to a darker berry.

Feels bubbly and thick and effervescent. This is a wonderful gateway beer, especially for a red wine drinker. Its very pleasant, and not incredibly challenging. The yeast-tart balance is like a slow-dance.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with big fizzy head and decent lacing. Nose is Very light malt and caramel. Tastes of wheat, caramel, molasses, light banana, and a stale bread. Thin palate. But overall it approves with warming.
Very good beer. Nice full head taste is sweet and wheaty. A slight watery flavor, but still a great beer.
Rated based on notes taken 20 Dec 2011 -- This is a very good Dunkel. In my opinion a classic and perfect example of the style. Would drink over and over again.
Cloudy dark brown pour. Some mash malt. Light hint of citrus. Easy drinking but not very exciting. Light sour finish. Bottle from grape and gourmet.
Dark brown in color thin tan head. Easy drinking dunkel. This was the quintessential Dunkel.
Very nice smell but wish it was more prominent, good flavor lots of malt low hops.....
Bottle at Lauras brothers place with James. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Aroma is sweet wheat, smooth. Taste is smooth creamy wheat super drinkable but a little sweet.

From bottle: Pours a caramel brown color with a small off white head. Smells of wheat, banana, clove, yeast and dark malts. Tastes of Wheat and dark malts with a hint of clove and banana. The malts taste of caramel and raisins. Highly carbontated mouthfeel. Easy to drink
Deep brown with a tan head. Malty, slightly sweet, nutty. Smooth and balanced with a it of tart crispness to the finish. Full body, yet light and drinkable.
Bottle. Medium brown in colour with a big, tan head. Sweet, caramel and yeasty grains, with some cloves and a gentle finish. Fine.
just a fantastic example of the style, done perfectly. could drink this all day long. love it.

Bottle from Harvest Market.
Pours a cloudy murky reddish brown with a tightly bubbled off white head that shows moderate retention. Aromas of banana and clove with hints of spice, light fruit, and earth. The flavor is fruity and spicy with clove and banana dominating. Light yeasty earthy flavors come in as well. Medium body with a spirited level of carbonation and a bubbly sweet mouthfeel. Nice dark Hefe, a bit bubbly for my tastes but they usually are.

Very light and refreshing, and Ill say that probably the best aspects of the beer are the slight sourness & banana-esters qualities from the strain of yeast used. I like my german beers a little more, either maltier or - I dont know, more substantial on the palate I guess. But a fine beer, nonetheless.

Red brown pour, nice foamy head.
Aroma is great, of banana, other dried fruit, yeast cherry, flavor is of prunes and wheat. Quite nice.

Poured from a bottle. Cloudy Caramel color, small off white head. Medium clove smell. Light wheat and clove flavor with a mild finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of sour malt, cloudy brown full creamy head. Taste of malt, slightly sour, with a grainy palate.
500ml bottle, thick dark brown with little carmel head. Slight coffee with plenty of carbonation. Light finish with a little citrus
500 ml bottle in Pompano Beach, Fl. Pours a murky brown with a full tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and bananas. Taste is bread and bananas. Palate is smooth.

Bottle. Pours an opaque brown with gorgeous, fluffy tan head that lasts. Smells of bubblegum, clove, and rye. Drinks smoothly with little lingering hop bitterness. Light to medium bodied. Tastes of sweet bread, bubblegum, cloves, and mild, earthy hops. Nice effervescence. Finishes clean.

Pleasantly opaque, with a gorgeous brown head that only diminishes, but not entirely goes away. Maintains a 1/8" to 3/16" head the entire way. A very classy visual profile that indicates a very well made beer. Goes down smooth and easy and is always very drinkable. A perfect balance between barley and wheat malts. As I like to say: "Belgium makes the best sipping beers, but Germany makes the best drinking beers."

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 500ml bottle into a tall weizen glass. The label has a "BEST BEFORE END" date and no abv.

Appearance: The body has a brownish tan color with a very hazy or cloudy look. From the pour I got an average size off white head that slowly settles to a light ring of foam. Lacing is very slick and slides right down the glass as I drink leaving no traces behind.

Smell: It has a deep yeast and wheat character. Classic German notes of banana and clove come through with a heavy sweet wheat presence. Hops are very distant and are barely noticeable.

Taste/Palate: There are big banana notes with spicy clove on a solid bed of sweet/sour doughy bready maltiness. The hops are laid back and offer very little bitterness and just a slight touch of earthy/leafy character. The palate has an almost chewy slick or creamy feel with soft carbonation.

Notes: Overall its a good solid Dunkelweizen with all the good classic German flavors.
Poured from a 1 PT. 9 FLOZ Bottle. Dark orange brown color and large light brown head. I smell yeast, caramel, fruit, banana and malt. I taste all the same, prefect:)!
January 2011. From bottle. Pours dark amber color with a white head. Aromas of malt, yeast, caramel, banana, spices. Slightly sweet finish.
Aroma is dark malts, dark bread, mild/medium earthy notes, bananas and sweetness. The flavor is bananas, mild sweetness/bubble gum, dark malts, fruit, slick texture and a tart/mildly sour finish.

Its unclear light brown with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of yeast, caramel, fruit and wheat. The sweet flavor has notes of yeast, caramel, fruit and wheat, and the finish is spicy with notes of caramel. Really well balance and nice!
Really great beer. Had one with two of my pals on the deck after a cookout.

0.5l bottle. Dark orange/brown body, light brown head. Aroma of banana, caramel, lemon zest and honey. Taste of caramel, toast, caramel, banana and lemon zest. Light-medium body. Very nice and refreshing beer.

Dark amber, hazy body and a tan head. Better aroma than taste. Sweet, banana, wheat, malty aroma. Sweet flavor, malty with a mild bit of yeast, banana and bread. Medium-light, lightly fizzy palate. Overall a nice, refreshing brew.
Pours a brownish reddish color, with tan head. Aroma of wheat and malt. Taste is typical for a wheat beer. A good effort, thumbs up!

I poured a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass. It has a best before date of May, 2013. It cost $3.29 ($0.19 per ounce).

Appearance: Opaque brown body with a glowing ruby red aura. Forms a large, white, frothy barm which mostly dissipates and leaves only minor lacing. 

Smell: Mostly just banana, no spice notes. Also quite mild.

Taste: Im a big fan of wheat beers. It seems to me that theyre a hard style to get wrong. Even if you make one by the book it may be unoriginal, but itll be good. For some reason, Julius Echter Hefe-Weiss-Dunkel comes up a bit short. While not a bad beer at all, its a little too mild for its own good. 

The palette doesnt have a lot of distinctive character to it. Similar to most German wheat beers with the usual notes of banana and clove, but this time theyre mild and contained. I prefer cinnamon bread character from a dunkelweizen, but this one is just plain bready. Theres a faint sweet taste right as it finishes, but its not a beer that I would consider robust. Thankfully, theres no off flavors, and those that are present become more prominent as it warms. Maybe its just an old bottle, but the fact remains this is an okay beer at best.

Drinkability: I deliberately bought and drank Julius Echter Hefe-Weiss-Dunkel for its performance value. I had just come back from a long walk on a hot, humid day and this was the refresher I was seeking. It was comfortable in the mouth with noticeable carbonation, but with a smooth finish. Its definitely refreshing and at only 4.9% ABV its ideal for hot weather in a large quantity over time
Tap. Brown color, small head and light lacing. Smooth throughout. Slightly sweet, but well balanced.

Dégustée en fût au Farmhouse Tap & Grill à Burlington, VT. De couleur brune-ambrée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, moyen dagrumes) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle), moyen de blé,  léger de gomme balloune avec des notes de caramel, de houblon herbeux et de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux petites notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, moyen de bananes) et moyennement épicées (clou de girofle,  traces de coriandre) avec des notes de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé avec un moyen goût de pain et un léger goût de céréales sucrées aux notes grillées puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen, composé dun goût de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, léger zeste dagrumes) aux notes épicées avec un léger goût de blé et de houblon herbeux ainsi que des traces de céréales grillées. (17 avril 2013)

500ml bottle, best by 2013/03. Poured into my weizen glass. Clear brown color. Big 2-finger pillowy off-white head. Thin bit retains, leaves some loose splotches of lace. Medium body. Smooth, sort of crisp carbonation, light bite to the finish, though. More dry overall. Banana in the nose. Toasty malt, little dark fruit, light spice, hint of vanilla, light herbal, little tobacco. Hint of tobacco. Hint of chocolate. Sweeter taste. Light bitter. TIny bite. Little dusty, lightly spicy. Bit watery overall. Still, a decent dunkelweizen.

Bottle. Sweet apricot, banana, and creamy wheat malt aroma. Cloudy brown with a large thick creamy off-white head. Fruity apricot, banana, and toasty malt flavor with just a touch of spice. Medium creamy body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle: Hazy, chestnut-amber coloured, smaller - stable and firm - off-white head, dried fruits and caramel in the yeasty-wheaty nose; moderate sweet-sourish flavour, smooth MF, medium bodied; sweetish caramelly finish. Really a decent Dunkelweizen....

Bottled 500ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Marko (thanks). Dark amber/brown coloured, medium to big sized pale beige head, mild banana in the nose. Toasted malt, slight yeasty and banana taste with hint of caramel in the finish. Nice.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Bottle @ Joes, Würzburg 31/01/13. Pours an auburn cola with an off-white, large head. Aroma is banana, caramel and cloves. Taste is caramel and banana. Light on the cloves. Light roast on the finish. Palate is light, quite carbonated, watery. Not that good really.

Julius Echter Premium Weissbier Dunkel, 5.3%. Poured a dark murky amber/brown body. Roasty yeasty dry sweet malty aroma. Malty taste with vague notes of banana, quite lactic/yeasty again. Hm, I expected more but its a nice drink in any case!

16.9 oz bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.).  Looks good; a semi-opaque brown with fluffy off-white lacing.  Smells solid; yeasty, doughy, malty, and roasty with notes of banana and spice.  Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel.  A good example of the style.

Buttery sweet malt aroma. Dark reddish brown body with some creamy head. Taste is sweet, malty, quite acidic spicey palate..also contributes to the taste. Overall, a solid dunkelweizen, but not spectacularly intense.
Smaczne i ciemne piwo pszeniczne. Treściwe i syte. Wspaniała piana. Gorycz umiarkowana. Kwaskowatość jest równoważona poprzez palony ciemny słód. Polecam szczególnie do posiłków.

Banana bread, spice, grape and citrus aromas. Enough going on to confuse the nose. Murky, swampy tan color, three finger velvety foam. Heavy banana flavor and some almost sour wines notes. Ester filled of course. Should not that its within a month of the best by date. Foamy and slick, lightweight for a dark beer. Not an even companion for the brewers hefe.
Purchased from Learys. Pours copper. Smells and tastes of esters, yeast, baked bread, cashew nuttiness, noble hops and some caramel. Decent for the style.

Murky dark amber with a thin white head. Esters and cloves on the nose. White grape and citrus fruit on the palate. The mouthfeel is the star of this show. Soft and elegant, yet lively and fresh. Great length.

pours cloudy nut brown with a towering, whipped, tan head.
Scent is clove, caramel malt...banana.
Taste is bready,rich, thick....yeast.
Very heavy, very full....very nice.
Wonderful beer.

500ml bottle - pours clear amber with excessive off-white creamy head.  Nose is banana and clove.  Flavor adds soggy bread.  Taste is lightly sweet.  Watery mouthfeel with stickiness in the back of the throat.  Easily the lightest Ive had for the style.  Has a slight porter aftertaste and also metallic.  Very burpy (buffalo chicken sandwich).
Dark brown color. Nice thick beige head. Aroma is caramel, cognac. Nice beer.

Pours a cloudy brown with an aggressive foamy off- white head with no lacing. The aroma is bananas and Belgian yeast. The taste is similar although I caught a hint of sourness at the bottom of the 500 ml  bottle. The mouthfeel was medium and smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 500mL bottle into Weiss glass. Appearance is a nice cloudy brown with a super foamy head that settles slowly. On the nose is sweet corn, banana, and citrus. Aromas are feint. Tastes of citrus, banana, and corn. I wasn't expecting the corn smells or flavors. Relatively high carbonation and smooth palate makes it an easy drinking brew. Overall, I prefer the standard vs the dark. The aromas and flavors are there but more bland than I was expecting. 

--- Cheers

Bottle at homebrew club. Pours a deep bronze with a big head. Nose is really nice. Light citrus and then a bunch of creamy banana and clove. Bready with a good wheat thing going on. Some cocoa in the nose as well. On tasting, creamy and full, good balance between the yeast and grain. Bready and full flavored. Really nice stuff.

Originally reviewed: 4/20/09. Pours a cloudy brown with a huge ivory head billowing forth. Great retention, but absolutely wanting of any lacing rings or sticky globs. Smells of nutmeg, banana, hints of clove, and bread. Very much a bready beer. 

Mouthfeel is a tad wet, but firm overall. Flavor was a little weaker than I was expecting, but good nonetheless. Some warm bready flavor with hints of brown sugar, slight fruitiness, and finishes sweet. Drinkability is high on this beer. There is nothing harsh here at all. Just a well-done Dunkel. Recommend.

Pours a (surprisingly) clear tea colored brown. Huge, foamy, lasting head. The aroma is of yeast, banana, toffee, oranges. Light bodied with a thin mouthfeel. Interesting flavor profile of overripe bananas, yeast, light coffee, light spice, butterscotch candy, Pleasant bitterness on the finish. A nice example of a somewhat obscure style to me.

500ml Bottle:  Got in trade from Florida; THANKS!  Aroma of malt, wheat, and some yeast.  Poured a muddy orange/brown in color with a small, creamy, tan head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer, as well as around the edges.  Opaque.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet and slightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, wheat, slight spice, grain, and some yeast.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, wheat, grain finish.
Great dark hefe, classic taste. Smooth rich dark brownish orange color with a white head.

500ml bottle.  Murky orange-burgundy brown.  Medium bodied, doesnt really strike me as a quality beverage like it used to.  Some extract butterscotch tones.  Nutty, but overall kind of bland.  Huge head, but soft carbonation.  A tad disappointing.
bottle pours a straw tellow with a  thin white head smells of bread banana not much in hops pretty good beer mellow.

Pours a very hazy brown with a dense off white head and a lot of lacing. Aroma is banana and spices, traditional hefe aroma. Taste is banana, spices, and nice maltiness. Very nice carbonation and mouthfeel. Enjoyed this one.

Refrigerated 500 mL bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours hazy medium brown with light brown highlights (top and bottom) and huge fluffy off-white head.  Thick lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and yeasty/banana aroma.  Taste is slightly sweet chocolate malt, banana, some clove, and a hint of brown sugar.  Less chocolate malt and more of the other favors as it warms.  This is good.
Bottle pours a hazy amber with a thick almost tan head. Scent is banana and spice. Taste is banana and yeast.

16.9 oz bottle.  Cloudy brown with a foamy white head.  Nose is banana, wheat, brown sugar and coriander.  Smooth and wheaty with a crisp bite.  Taste is club soda, light molasses and clove.  Clean and classic with some body sacrificed for drinkability.

Bottle poured at RIFT Dunkelweizen calibration tasting. Aroma hinted at toastier malts beneath. I preferred this over their straight Hefe but thought it was less capturing than the other Dunkelweizen examples we had. Just not all that much malt richness and depth and some thin, kind of seltzery lightness to it.

500 mL bottle: Appearance is a medium brown, hazy with a slow fading off white creamy head. Aroma is of yeast, pale malt and hints of alcohol. Taste is a well mixed blend of malt, yeast and caramel, somewhat breaddy also.
Pours dark brown with heavy foam.  A lot of yeast in the aroma, with a little clove.  Wheat flavor with some banana and clove, with a smooth finish.  Very nice.
Pours a mahogany color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of wheat, banana, and some yeast.  Flavor is similar with lots of the banana and yeast on the finish.  Very delicious.

500 mL bottle from Beers of Europe.  Very dark brown with a lively head.  Smells very wheaty, with a hint of malt.  Tastes lightly of weak, but also of a sweet roast.  Pretty nice, mild and tasty, but not quite delerium with every sip.  One of the better German beers.

(500ml bottle best by 11/2011) cloudy brown pour, thick creamy tan head with nice lacing. Nose of dark bread, raisin, clove, and wheat. Taste of cream, raisins, medium sweet grainy bread, and banana. Creamy body, a bit watery, medium to thin body.

Bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  Murky brown with a thick cream head.  Nose is wheat, spices, and circus peanuts.  Very smooth on the palate, wheat comes through in the end and fruits and spices in the front.
Herber und recht trockener Antrunk. Das Malz wird hier kaum ersichtlich, im Mittelteil nur wenig. Wässrig, wenig aromatisch, kurzer unspektakulärer Abgang. Langweilig. 9/5/4/3/5/3

hazy brown with a thick white head, very effervescent, medium-full body with very high carbonation.

aroma: banana bread, tart wheat, minerality.

taste: minerality, brown malt, green banana, tart wheat, and a touch of stale hops.

Pours dark amber with little head.  Light notes of malt drive into a deeper malt and grain palate.  The finish is slighlty sweet with the grains lasting much longer.....seems simple but actual shows off a bit complex.

Notes: Overall its a good solid Dunkelweizen with all the good classic German flavors.

poured from bottle an off brown color with nice head. the smell of sweet malt and wheat.. this was a very mild beer that had a great flavor of malty wheat and bread. was pleasantly surprise on how mild the flavor is..i would and will drink another.

The pour is a very light hazy gold with a decent head and lacing. 

It smells very light and sweet notes of grass and citrus.

The taste is very smooth and drinkable for wiess, but nothing hard to catch my attention. Almost to light and smooth.

Awesome brew. Brown caramel colored beer with a tan head. Aromas of caramel, sugar, and some honey. Tastes of sugar, caramel, molasses, some prunes, bits of chocolate, and wheat. Nicely balanced beer is a prime example of the style. A bit cloying on the sweetness, but very well done.
Pours a hazy medium brown with a very large tan/off-white head. Aroma of banana, toast and soap. Flavor of caramel, cloves and some banana. Enjoyed this one.

Bottle. Fizzy, off-white head atop a deep amber body. Aroma of caramel, banana and toasted grain. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately bitter, lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, velvety texture and fizzy carbonation. Initial sweetness gives way to acidic tartness and some bitterness. Taste of banana, clove, some earthiness.

Bottle from Decanted. From a vigorous pour, a full inch of off-white head forms over a dark caramel body. The aroma is sharp and soapy with dusty yeast. Flavors of bread, apple sauce, and metal in the finish. Thin/medium body and medium carbonation. Decent.
Very hazy dark brown with a thin off-white head.  Aroma of bread, grain, and roasted malt.  Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.  Good balance.

cloudy dark cider color with a generous head and lacing.  Taste is consistent through the finish, starting with oily caramel malt, moving into a mild bittering in the finish accented by light anise.  A solid dunkel, especially at such a low abv.

Bottle @ home.  Pours a very hazy medium brown body with a tinge of redness.  Small tan head that dissipates very quickly.  Dark wheat malts, banana, and a touch of sourness in the nose.  Somewhat creamy mouthfeel.  Dark wheat and medium sized body with notes of banana and cloves and a touch of sourness.  Finish is pretty malty with a small dark wheat aftertaste.  Average Dunkelweizen.

Cloudy dark amber/cider color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of wheat, some yeast, caramel malt, toffee, & brown sugar; Flavor of wheat, yeast, bananas, dark fruit, caramel, and some chocolate; Nicely balanced; Overall, pleasantly surprised by this one - really good dunkelweizen.

Bottle.  Pours a light but deep, red/brown.  Very murky.  Fluffy white head.  Sweet, bready, hefe head.  Flavor is more balanced.  Fuity and bready but neither in too high a quantity.  Im generally not a big fan of this style but this beer is very good.

Murky brown pour with a brown hinted fluffy white head.  Decent retention and minimal lacing.  Not getting much from the smell here.  Malts and dark fruits with some bananas.  Not at all what I expected when I tasted it. Almost like a wheat beer, but with some dark roasted malts.  Medium Bodied.  Leaves you with some dryness.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Cloudy brown with a beige head. Aromas of banana, malts, wheat, toffee and caramel. Flavours of licorice, stewed apple, dark fruits and toffee. Good sweet and spicy mouthfeel. Dry, sweet and malty finish. Nice.

She pours with a soft foamy head draped in khakis and tans looking much like whipped coffee ice cream, another special childhood memory. Her body underneath resembles soft pumpernickel bread marked by a gentle haze that lets just enough light in to give her dark hues a pleasing glow. Bran muffins, cinnamon, bananas, clove, apricot, figs, and dark breads reach out to me from the safe confines of my hefeweizen glass. Red apple skins for a touch of bitterness before I am back in the lap of banana bread and clove luxury. Enough of this smelling stuff; Im parched. Sweeter than her nose let on, but considering the larger addition of darker malts, I am appropriately not surprised. Red apples, maple, and apricots dapple in the fruity side along with plump white raisins and dates. Her soft mouthfeel exudes cinnamon and brown sugar which lingers long after each generous quaff. There are sippers and then there are drinkers, the latter of which the Julius Echter Dunkel Hefeweizen definitely qualifies. Fresh banana slices lay atop banana bread warm from the oven. Clove subtly weaves in and out of each flavor and my glass empties far sooner than anticipated.


You would think that in the sunny state of Florida, hefeweizen would be a guaranteed crowd pleaser. Not so, unfortunately, and I find the ripe esters of banana and clove that makes a hefeweizen a hefeweizen to be the general offender. For anyone a bit unsure as to the beauty of a traditional German hefeweizen, maybe a dip into the dark side first will do the palate some good. If not, it just means more Julius Echter Dunkel Hefeweizen for me.

Bottle pour with a big, tan foamy head, cloudy, dark like coffee. Aromas of medium roasted malts, cooked plums and cherry. Flavors were not overpowering. A bit of nutmeg and clove spice up front, no bitterness, a bit of fruit sweetness and an interesting metallic twing on the finish. Nothing special about the palate, hung around for a bit, a bit oily, with a thin carbonation. 
A good brew, quality ingredients noticeable, a nice abv content, very drinkable, but I dont find anything about it that really makes it stand out.

500 ml bottle. Thanks liveFREEorRYE!  Awesome brew! Poor s a murky, muddy water color. The aroma is of soft banana, light wheat and sweet caramel/toffee like malt with undertones of earth, butter and spices alongside a tiny touch of chocolate. The flavor is wheaty with light notes of sweet malt and banana. Light to medium mouth feel. To murky to tell carbonation.  I could drink this any day of the week and twice on Tuesday!

Bottle from the Orland Park, IL, Binnys Beverage Depot:  This poured a brownish amber body with a Huge, rocky beige head.  The aroma was dark toffee, soft fruit, and a light spiciness.  The flavor was quite reflective of the nose but seemed a bit magnified.  Very nice brew.
Very tasty dunkel. Pours brown w light beige head; smells of malty hefe. Taste is crisp, refreshing, smooth

Bottle in IN - Im still miffed about missing this one after an embarrassing incident in LE about four years ago.  Best before Feb 2011.  Beautiful nose of dark chocolate, candy sugar, spice, molasses, plum, berry, toffee, mineral, light smoke - just loaded!  Cloudy rich brown color, just hits the sweet spot, with an indomitable rocky beige head.  Taste is dominated by yeasty flavors, heavy mineral and lighter spice, with some air.  A little slimy.  Sweet and mildly fruity, dries out only a little by the end.  Good, which for this style is impressive.
Pours a deep reddish brown with a medium tan head.  Aroma is citrus, clove, banana and even some caramel.  Taste is sweet and tracks along the aroma.  Very very smooth mouthfeel.
Brown - really thick head.  Aroma mostly of yeast and a bit of bubblegum.  Taste has a lot of dark spice flavor to it - almost with cinnamon.  Finish is quick with a good amount of carbonation.

500ml bottle from Half Time. Pours very cloudy dark amber with a foamy 4-finger off-white/beige head. Aromas of banana and clove. Medium minus body with lightly frothy carbonation. Flavor is dark wheat, clove, banana and a bit of citrus. It is mildly fruity and relatively dry. Finishes a touch earthy. This is not an extreme beer (4.9%- NS), but it is a very tasty beer. You want sessionable? Here ya go.

Serving:  500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.
Aroma: Primarily yeasty nose with some dark fruit, pumpernickel, and spicy wheat notes. 
Appearance:  It pours a cloudy brownish red with a sizable foamy off-white head.  Good head retention and spotty lacing left behind.
Taste: The taste initially carries all the notes from the nose, but in a much lighter package than the nose belies.  A nice bit of bready malt with dark fruit notes, but the wheat lightens things up and dries them out quite a bit.  What you are left with is both quite tasty and very drinkable.
Palate: Light to medium body with average carbonation and a dry, fruity finish. 
Overall: An enjoyable change when you are looking for something lighter light a wheat, but with a darker malt profile.  A very nice brew and definitely recommended.
Score: 8.4.7.4.14

Bottle.  Clear brown pour with a light beige head that leaves a quarter inch.  Aroma of banana, cloves and bread.  Taste is a crisp blend of caramel, yeast, wheat and lemon.  Thin palate.  Light tinny penny vibe.  Very drinkable.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2010 Dirt cheap down the street at specs and very good. many repeat buys, both this one and the hell

(500 ml bottle (best before end 11/10) from Tullys) Pours cloudy lightly brownish amber with a really tall light khaki head in my weizen. Cloudier deeper into bottle. Aroma of banana, wheat, clove and herb. Mouthfeel nicely smooth and "wheaty".  Big, droopy rings of lacing. Flavor of fairly mild banana, spice, wheat and clove. A very good and refined, although a bit restrained, example of the style.

500ml bottle, 5.3%. Muddily opaque with an uneven, clinging whip of foam. Aroma has hints of stewed English fruits; rhubarb, plum and blackberry as well as fig and the requisite banana, all liberally pinched with clove, pepper and spiced biscuit. Soft banana candy, plum, cinnamon and honey on the palate; milky fine and oozing with understated fruit and spice. Some chocolate and biscuit to finish; hint of earth. Massively drinkable, juicy dunkelweizen.

Recommended by Mike at Roger Wilco in Sicklerville. Great light aroma of banana and clove, wheat and fruit. Pours a cloudy amber with a small head. Flavor is very nice dominated by the banana and clove but some nice malt sweetness in the background and some hops up front. Finish is very dry and refreshing. A very nice hot weather beer.
Very smooth. Caramel colored wheat beer. Nose and taste of bready molasses and caramel. Rated 5/10/05

Served from a slightly larger than 12 ounce bottle at a local beertasting event. Dark orange, light brown in color with a nice thick head that recedes quickly. Banana flavors with bread and earthy grass notes.
I picked up a bit of chocolate and malt flavor with some more grassy flavors and a bit of banana. Light-Medium  bodied, smooth and creamy.
Very refreshing, a bit more flavor profile than the JE Hefe-Weissbier. Stands up on its own or would go well with a cheeseburger on the grill.

The way you made love to me last Summer,you ruined my Spring .. . Pours a murky typical brown .. big stern head, decent lacing .. light chocolate dipped bananas, and doughy notes .. . good, but i liked the original better..

From the 500 ml. bottle with a date of 2010/06-08:24.  It pours a somewhat hazy darker amber tone with a thick, puffy beige head.  AS a blow on the head it flutters.  The aroma is slightly malty but it has more of an aroma of toast, charcoal, and molasses (maybe). The scent is entirely inviting. The  mouthfeel falls in the heavier range.  The taste is has a baked biscuit or bread like sensation to it. It isnt too bad but there are better ones out there.
Bottle. Brown and pored with a big head..Subtle wheatiness.  Pleasant but nothing special.
A bit more yeasty and gritty than most.  Nice aromas of bannanas.  A slightly more hoppy than most in the style.  Dark roasted malts are balanced with the citrus/banana flavors.

Huge tan head above a super hazy brown murky body, almost has a weizen bock quality about it... Hoppy aroma over notes of banana and clove with some sweetness... Oddly hoppy but not unpleasant flavor with big notes of yeast banana and clove... almost has a belgian quality to it... very interesting medium bodied..
Malty aroma with hints of nuts. Light brown color with a taste that has chocolate and nuts in there.

A rather odd name for a German Hefe but nonetheless not a bad brew. The typical Dunkel look applies here with a cloudy lightly burnt maroon color and carbonated body provides for a half inch tan head. While the flavor was pretty well on target with dark malts and banana, the body was just a bit thin.

Pour is cloudy light brown with a big old wheaty head.  The aroma is toasty with just a touch of hefe characteristics.  The flavor is rather light for a hefe and a dunkel.  There is some hefe in there, but theres a lot of caramel, nuts, and bread in there.  The carbonation is quite high, even cold.
Bottle from the Gingerman in Fort Worth.  Medium brown pour with a big tan head.  Lots of wheat and dark fruit aroma.  Very nice, bready flavor.

50cl bottle.
Pours copper, white head.
Aroma and flavor. Yeasty, wheat with strong emphasis on dark fruits; raisins, some caramel notes and malts.
Finish had light notes of hops bitterness.
0,5 L bottle. Cloudly, semi-brown color. Aroma is fresh, yeaty. Color and aroma like traditional estonian countryside homebrew. Wheat and yeasty tones in flavor.

Appears almost as a cider color, with apricot edges. Pillowy white head. Aroma is dark surgary sweet. Banana notes, brown sugar, and caramel. mmmMMMMmm very nice flavor to match the aroma. Still lots of banana and carmal, sweet but not overpowering very mellow and tasty.

hazy brown pour. fluffy head that dissipates after a few minutes.  Aroma is malty with banana, cloves, molasses, raisins.  Flavor is more molasses like sweet maltiness with some nutty/chocolate flavors as well as some chocolate covered banana.  I thoroughly enjoy good dunkels and this is no exception.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange brown with tons of fluffy head. Aroma is malty bannana and clove, maybe a bit frutier than bannana. Taste is wheaty and fruity with some minor chocolate notes coming through in the end. A slight bitterness in the middle as well. This is a new style to me, so it took me a few sips to get used to it, but I do rather enjoy it. Mouthfeel is light and mildly carbonated.

Has a hazy dark brown color.  Aroma is mainly of yeast.  Has some undertones of malts, cherries, cloves, and molasses.  Taste is full of yeast and some sweeter notes.  Leaves a pleasant yeasty aftertaste.

(bottle - 500 ml) Light brown color with a fluffy tan head. Aroma is light and sweet with good hints of bananas and cloves. Some grains. Flavor is light and bready at the start with a light sweetness. Some light malts blend with light hints of banana and clove and a slightly bitter wheat flavor. Very carbonated.

500 ml. bottle. Pours  an enormous fluffly, off white head, over a cloudy light brown (SRM 10-12) body.......nose is fruity (apple, banana), spicy (light clove), lemony, malty (bread).....taste is soft malts (cereal), light lemon, apple, bit of clove spice with a tiny funky finish.....carbonation fairly high, mouth feel overall is light. Lovely for a warm day.

Bottle pour.Smell was bananas and wheat with a hint of sweets.Poured a light brown color with a good beige head.Flavor was wheat and yeast with some fruitiness.Easy to drink and enjoyed this thoroughly.
0,5 L bottle. Cloudly, semi-brown color. Aroma is fresh, yeaty. Color and aroma like traditional estonian countryside  homebrew. Wheat and yeasty tones in flavor. Good! and nostalgic.

Bottle on sale, drink by 2009/05. Poured into Hefe glass, huge white head on top of hazy, apple cider body. Kind of light in the body, assertive carbonation. Slightly tangy. I didnt detect much dunkel-ness (caramel and so on), nor bananas, cloves, et. al. Maybe a fresher bottle wouldve been more special.

500 mL bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy copper color with a very large creamy, frothy head. Aroma of yeast, spice and light bread. Taste is bread, caramel, spice, green apple, citrus and other fruits. Medium bodied. I quite like this one.
Bottle from Sams. Cloudy caramel color with near-white head that holds on. Wheat, yeast, bananas, caramel, and slight chocolate on the nose. Slight lemon zing. A bit grainy but solid.
Pours hazy caramel color with off white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast and cardboard. Sweet caramel flavor with yeast and citrus. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
Brownish red color. Aroma has a mostly sweet quality to it but is mostly malty. Taste is unremarkable and is basically a textbook example of a dunkel.

Pours lighter than your usual dunkel.  A orange tinted brown.  Aroma is fruity and reminds me of lychees.  I smell some clove, wheat, yeast, caramel, and banana.  Flavor has some banana, caramel, wheat, yeast, and bubblegum.  Overall the taste is slightly sweet.  The mouth feel is smooth and highly carbonated. This is really a refreshing dunkel.

Murky orange-brown, not as dark as most dunkels.  A two finger off white lasting head.  Aroma is big banana, bubblegum, some caramels.  Taste is more banana and bubblegum, some lemon and clove spice in the finish.  Good, but not the burnt sugar Im used to in a dunkel.
Taste 3/1 Bottle. Looks: Brown murk with a nice steady head. Aroma: Banana, wheat/grain, lemon, orange peel. Taste: Nice smooth body. Spicy lemon and orange peel and cloves.

Poured at the Gulfstream beer fest.  Nice beer. Orange/brown pour.  Nice off white head.  Aromas of brown sugar, caramel, banana bread, and cloves.  Flavor is really nice.  The wheat is present with some sweetness that has notes of caramel and honey.  I taste some banana and a faint amount of tartness..almost lemony. A great mouthfeel.  Good beer.

This Dunkelweizens aroma was average for the style and i detected the presence of malt, banana, and caramel. Its a cloudy brown color with exceptional carbonation and lacing. It tasted amazing and was very smooth and refreshing on my palate. It gets a 15 overall because its a damn good beer!

Bottled, BB 3/31/09.  Poured medium orange with a creamy cap of off-white head.  The aroma picked up caramel and brown sugar sweetness along with banana notes.. soft and inviting.  The flavor had the same sweetness at the core (banana, caramel, and brown sugar), and added a pinch of chocolate.. mild dry spices and more sweetness on the edges.. balance was great.  Medium-bodied with rolling carbonation on the palate.. spiciness and mild bitterness played well.  This was quite delightful.
Light brown and hazy.  Larger size but it disappears pretty quickly.  Aroma is of banana.  Taste is fruity with banana with a  sweet malty finish.  Easy going taste

500ml bottle,  best before Sep 22 2008.  Cloudy brown, creamy bright white head.  Aroma is of toasted wheat, arroz con gandules, grassy hops, and cloves.  I love the aroma of the premium style of a dunkelweizen.  Flavor of wheat, lots of malted wheat, some light toast is present, lots of bread.  Very dry.  First food that comes to mind are broiled smelts.  Delicious.  The flavors of this bottle consist of a sweet maltiness, balanced bitterness, some ripe banana, hint of clove.  Bold caronation tingles on my tongue.  Finishes dry, with a mouthful of fruitiness left on the palate.  Hint of lemon acidity.  I really enjoyed this bottle  It could be a regular favorite of mine.  Prost!
A pretty nice aromatic balance of banana and cloves. Lots of head. Flavor is pretty nice. A bit too much wheat for me. Decent. Quite creamy. A little too lactic.
Pours a hazy copper/orange with a thick off whie head.  Aroma is clean, yeasty and metallic. Light taste, not much od a palate.  Banana and lemon with malt.
Hands down the best Dunkel Weiss in Germany...and trust me I have tried most of them.  Great traditional German Weiss  A must try
Bottle.  Pours a dark brown body with a creamy white head.  German style maltiness, caramel sweet with fruity banna esters and clove.  A note of chocolate.  Good brew.

Pours a murkey caramel color with a beautiful creamy off white head that looks like ice cream at the top of my weizen. Nose is wheat, clove, bit of banana. Taste is very mild but smooth and refreshing. A thirst quencher but not really complex. Enjoyable.

Poured a cloudy caramel color that looked like unfiltered apple cider. There was a good tall tan head that went down rather quickly to eventually just a film. There was very little lacing and what was there slid down the glass to the level of the beer. The aroma was lightly sweet with a faint scent of apple with a bit of malty sweetness. The taste was slightly tart, crisp, clean with good carbonation. Light flavor of a Granny Smith apple.  The taste was fairly even throughout with not much of a change on the finish. Nice beer.

Medium beige lasting head. Amber hazy body with carbonation. Light roasty bananaish aroma with spicy peppery notes. Dryish-sweetish roasty papery bananaish taste with fruity notes. Very light acidity. Mild mouthfeel, mild taste. Full-bodied. Dryish chalky fruity aftertaste with light hop notes lingers. Nice. (0.5l bottle, Thüringer Hof, Leipzig.)

Bottle from Kegs & barrels in McKinney, TX.
Pours a very nice looking cloudy light brown/amber with nice, thick beige head. Aroma of Bannana and faint caramel. Flavor much the same with a little clove, very faint dark roast. Mouthfeel is medium, soft, med-high carbonation....enjoyable.

Bottled.  Cloudy amber, creamy head. Aroma of toffee and ripe banana. Sweet and medium bodied with rounded mouthfeel.A bit of grass to complimet the ripe banana and caramel. A pleasant but unassuming dunkelweizen.
Cloudy brown with an light  beige head.  fruity taste that is a bit tangy.  Moderately carbonated that finishes smoothly.  A good Dunkel Weiss but not a favorite.
Botella. German rating # 400. Bit hazy amber-brown colour. Aroma of wheat and some banana with caramel and dark fruits. Good mouthfeel. The flavour has caramela and wheat with some dark fruits.

Bottle. [thank you, faroeviking]
Pours a hazy, pale, brown with a small, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has light chocolate, some slight banana and caramel - weak roasted tones as well. Okay mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Flavour is soft and rather weak, light chocolate and caramel. Not much to like nor dislike.

Pours a muddy brown, beige soapy head.
Subdued banana-bread aroma.
Very good mouthfeel, nice balance of carbonation and thickened wheat-y-ness.
Very mild flavor, some citrus and bread, a little nutmeg, but somewhat watery.
This is not quite there, but definitely enjoyable.

(bottle) Cloudy, murky brown colour with a massive and slightly tanned foamy head, leaving lace-work. Sweet and yeasty-fruity (blackcurrant, prunes, banana) aroma with wheat- and dark malt, chocolate and light clovy spice. Sweet and slightly sourish flavour, light bodied with a moderate carbonation. Wheaty and shy toasty taste with berries and banana; sweet and banana-fruity finish. A tad too sweet for my liking (24.07.08).

Bottled. Pours thickly cloudy root-beer-float brown, fading beige pillowy head. Mild nose of ripe, caramelized bananas. Lightly sweet, bready flavor with caramel, hint of brown sugar, touch of sourdough. Tangy finish. Maybe blander than necessary. Still pretty nice.
Pours a merky amber color with a huge tan foamy head. Aroma of yeast and banana. Taste is thin. A hint of spice maybe clove. Not much here.
Smells of yeast that is past its prime. Cloudy light brown color with a large almond head. Moderately sweet in the beginning and fading in the finish. Mild tang in the end.

.5L bottle from the rip and run.  A brand I have never heard of has two bottles on the shelves???!!! an on a dunkel???? well this is a red letter day. Pours a gloupy iced tea brown, no clumps but definatly yeast and very cloudy.  Head is lasting and dense. White and rocky.  Boedy is light to medium with some light fruit and a skoash of malt in both nose and body.  Quick body is a nice refresher.  Bitter finish, some pepper and clove tones that are washed out.  Ehh.

Big off-white head. Muddy water color to it. Banana in the aroma, along with some spices. Bananas in the taste. Medium body. Really smooth. Sour finish. Some sweetness. Noticed a little bit of caramel. Pretty nice brew.

(Bottle) Pours brown with an amber-ish glow and a creamy off-whit head. The aroma is of soft banana, light salty wheat and sweet caramel/toffee/fudge like malt with undertones of earth, mint bubblegum, butter and spices alongside a tiny touch of chocolate. The flavour is wheaty with light notes of sweet malt and banana. Light to medium sweet, light acid and tiny bitter. The mouthfeel is creamy with a tickling carbonation. A touch of dark fruits. Medium bodied.
bottle. cloudy off yellow color.aroma of fruit and nuts and banana. tastes like it smells and an easy drinker. Nice!
Bottle - Poured a light brown amber with some foam head.  Aroma of Banana, pepper and bread.  Rather light malt pallet and mild.  Easy drinker.

Cloudy orange in color with a full, dense foam that morphs into plateaus.  Very nice aromatics, with clove, banana and spice notes.  Flavor doesnt have the fullness of flavor that would make it outstanding, but it has nice flavors of vanilla and ripe fruit.  Could have more depth and more weizen characteristics.  Its just okay.
bottle, nutty brown color with banana spice flavors, a little soft on the finish with some root beer

A very subpar dunkelweizen. Aroma was so so. Banana and clove with a hint of wheat. Pour was a a beautiful bubble light brown with a huge pillowy 4 finger tan head that I had to cut through with a knife. Taste was very flat. No carbonation at all. Strong banana and clove in the front with a cola like aftertaste. If this beer had more carbonation it would have been great.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: I believe I may have gotten a bad bottle because I have no appreciable aroma. After the beer sits for a moment a strange watery strata forms on the top. I am not thrilled with a good depth of flavor it is rather hallow and unsatisfying. I feels fine in the mouth with fine carbonation and no real after taste. Not Aventinus.

(GERMANY) This Hefe-weiss dunkel has a nice hazy brown color with a dissipating white head. The aroma is of warm bread, banana, and straw. Taste has a slightly thick mouthfeel of caramel / malts.  Nice carbonation and lovely lacing, a bit on the weak side but refreshing !!!

Bottle, shared at the May 2008 tasting.  Thanks Hockey28!  Big fluffy head.  Nose is banana & chocolate, yeast & malt.  Flavor is cocoa, banana, malt.  Quite fresh for something thats traveled from German.
Bottle at Rudys tasting May 08.  Dark hazy dirt brown, small white head.  Malty yeasty aroma.  Good taste, very fresh, yeast, making it very drinkable.  Solid stuff.
Hazy orange body, little head.  Slightly sour aroma.  Flavor is citrusy and tart with some sweetness and a mild hoppiness.  Very tasty and drinkable.
bottle. pours a cloudy dirty lighter brown color. Aromas of cloves, bananas, dark bready, caramel sugary taste. almost a lighter version of Aventinus. Decent

A cloudy looking beer that pours a huge head! Only head Ive seen bigger is that of a Boddingtons. This has an easily detected citrus, almost melon taste to it. Definitely something different from what Im used to. They served it with a lemon, no need for that. I discarded that quickly. It was very expensive, so I probably wont get it again
bottle ...cloudy ruddy brown pour. medium beige head ,some lace . aroma of yeasty banana and caramel . sweet fruit , light malt flavor  good carbonation ,a little thin

Bottle purchased at Coaltrain Wine & Liquor in Colorado Springs, CO.  Pours hazy brown with an average, frothy, light brown head, mostly lasting with fair lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, straw, hay), light hops (grass), heavy yeast (dough, earth) with notes of roasted banana and grapes.  Medium to light bodied, sticky texture, lively carbonation, and a metallic finish.  Average duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2008 [1081-20080201] 1pt (c/o mds, w/ him, blankboy, GregClow, jerc). Sweet honeyed yeast aroma with a bit of fruity funk. Hazy, dark brown red body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Flavour has a bit of Belgian sweet yeast and caramelized cereal grain corn. Medium-full body. Nice balance. (6/3/7/3/14) 3.3

[1368B-20080517] Bottle. Fruity banana yeast and doughy bread aroma has a bit of fresh sweet booze. Hazy, light brown body with quick off-white bubbles. Sweet boozy banana peel flavour has some doughy yeast and malt. Medium body. Nice balance of fruit and yeast. (6/3/7/3/14) 3.3
(c/o hockey28, w/ others)

Bottle poured into my trusty stein- poured 80% transparent light brown, light carbonation, nice off tan head formed and was creamy.  Aroma of yeast and light banana note.  Hits the mouth with a high-thin body, malt is distinguishable but a little weak, finish has a cream with caramel note.
Light brown and hazy.  Larger size but it disappears pretty quickly.  Aroma is of banana.  Taste is fruity with banana with a  sweet malty finish.  Easy going taste

Pours caramel cloudy tan/brown. 16oz of foam, Takes a good while for the head to get out of time out. Pretty weak aroma of barley and carmel. Flavor is of sugary wheat and caramel. Kinda sweet. Not my favorite, but full bodied, flavorfull and no wimp. No lacing on the glass. What does that mean. You know. This beer contains hops extract, WTF!
Pours a nice dark apple sauce color.  Frothy mouth.  Nose isnt the best ive seen in this class.. mainly yeast.  Flavor is mild, smooth and a little tart.  Good

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2008 Rerate: Bottle (500ml) shared at Rudolfs May 2008 Tasting -- courtesy of Hockey28. Pours a hazy orange-brown with an average size diminishing off-white head. Aroma has lots of caramel, light Euro hops (Fuggles or Goldings?), fruit and yeast. Malty flavour with caramel or toffee, fruit and yeast. Medium bodied. Very nice and better then I expected. (especially since Ive had it before).

Bottle shared with jerc, mabel, GregClow & mds -- courtesy of mds. Pours a hazy ruby with an average size lasting off-white head. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, fruit and light yeast. Slightly watery flavour of fruit and light malt -- not much going on here. Light to average bodied. A mediocre version of the style.
bottled @ downtown bar. Pours a hazy burnt siena, aroma is typical dunkel weiss as is taste, bananas caramel etc -- but very very well done.  Highly recommended.

Bottle.

Bottle shared with jerc, mabel, blankboy & mds - courtesy of mds. Hazy ruby-orange with a small head. Aroma of malt, candy floss, and a bit of yeast. Thin body. Flavour is flat and watery - theres some mild malt and a hint of tartness, but not much else. There are some good ratings for this below, so I suspect we mightve been drinking from an old bottle.
A refreshing beer. Definitely drinkable, but also not very distinct or memorable. Some tastes include yeast, citrus, some spice. Good flavors.

Mighty fine Dunkelweizen, very complex and soft I was surprised by how wonderful this wheat beer is. Vinous aroma with dark sweet fruits as well as a nice banana presence. Vanilla and lightly spiced scents come forward as the beer warms. Hazy reddish-copper, dark at the wide top of my glass and gradually lightens down toward the stem. Large creamy cap with stings of lacing. Moderate malt body, crisp with a drawn out smoothness. Delicate and tantalizing to the palate. Flavor is a wonderful marriage of fresh wheat and port. Banana, spicy cloves, and cherries are all rolled in there as well. This reminds me of a wheat based version of Unibroues Trois Pistoles. Nice layers of flavors, this is excellent.

Bottle 16oz. pours deep brown with a light brown, decent head. Taste of clove, pear, and cream. Aroma is clove. Palate is smooth and round with a nice sweet aftertaste. One of my first Dunkels, very tasty.

500- ml bottle poured a cloudy copper brown with a lasting amber head. Aromasa of carmel apples, wheat, yeast and light clove. Palate was light to medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, fruitiness, wheat and yeast with a smooth dry fruity finish.

Pours with a frothy, light tan colored, initially three finger thick head that sits on top of a dark, amber tinged, brown colored brew that shows a lightly hazy, rich, ruby hue when held up to the light.  Quite fruity smelling with notes of raisins, green grapes, and Macintosh apples.  Malt notes of toasted grain, browned bread crust and complex and rich malt notes are pretty noticeable if you dig a bit for them.  More typical Hefe Weizen aromas of banana and clove come in as a sort of backdrop or supporting role.  At times it almost smells a bit like vanilla poached apples.

Light, but chewy enough that it is not watery at all.  The beer is lightly sweet with flavors of vanilla, raisins, tart apples and some spicy clove notes.  The darker malt flavors really turn on in the finish were a nice toasted malt flavor is evident; lightly toasted whole grain bread, a hint of chocolate and browned / caramelized malt sugars.  As my palate gets used to the flavors notes of banana and even some vanilla flavors start to come out.  This has an appetizing tartness to it that really makes this beer quite drinkable as well as cutting through the malt to keep this quite drinkable.  The yeast pour softens the beer a bit, it becomes rounder and loses a spicy sharpness that was there before.

Another interesting beer from this brewery, this could perhaps be a touch more focused on the Dunkel grain notes, but it does contribute.  A refreshing, easy drinking version that really starts to open up once it becomes a bit warmer.

(Bottle) Pours a hazy brown color with a large beige head. Aroma of clove, wheat, and some light malt. Taste is similar, with a even spicy taste and full mouthfeel. Average carbonation. Better than their regular hefe in my opinion.

The flavor is pretty unremarkable... mainly a buttery, nutty malt character that is pleasant, but not too memorable. Good mouthfeel, though. Good for the price. At one time, this was one of my favorite beers, but it just doesnt stand up to all the really great beers that are available.

Bottle: Rusty brownish orange, with a thin but frothy head.  The aroma is very subtle ... you have to really inhale hard to get the banana creme lurking there. A nice smelling beer with caramel malt character.  Not much in the way of weiss flavor, but still pretty good.

16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a brown liquid with a nice head that sticks around . Nice lacing on the tumbler. Slight sweet malt aroma with black pepper and spices. Smooth and creamy in the mouth. Not a tart flavor for this weiss; more of semi-sweet chocolates, roasted grains, and yeast here. 

A smooth and easy drinking brew.

Pours a brown body with a reasonable head. Aroma dominated by banana with a hint of caramel. Flavor is the same. Smooth and a solid example for the style.

Pours light brown with orangish hues and a massive creamy off-white head.  Dusty phenolic peppery aroma of banana and spice. Lightly sweet and moderately acidic with a high level of sophistication and balance. Medium bodied with a high level of carbonation. Great!
Poured a cloudy tan, fluffy off white head that lasted. Nose of banana with yeast. Nice flavor a little light very drinkable. Nice wheat flavor through out.

Pours a bit lighter color than most dunkeweisses.  This one was just a medium to deep amber and a modest head. This wasnt a very bad dark hefe but it could have been better. It wasnt too smooth but the flavors were good. Id like to give it another try.

16oz bottle: poured orange/brown, not like other dunkels I have had. Big thick offwhite head. Light banana aroma with a bit of lemon. Flavor comes up short. Very light yeast with banana esters. Ive had a lot better.

Hazy dark brown pour with aroma of hopcit, wheat, figs, clove.  Tastes weissy with some dunkly finishing elements such as figs, caramel malt, and toffee.  Nice style.
