Banana aroma is quite subdued with some rye-like cereal spiciness, bread dough-like yeastiness and a lightly woody character.  Some rounded toffee-like caramelization.  Hazy rosé-tan with decent off-white head that recedes to cover.  Banana flavour and very light spicing with a very rounded toffee-like caramelized flavour.  Medium body with fairly low carbonation and a somewhat sweet, unattenuated feeling to it.  Bottle sampled with asheft and Pitpit.

Bronze-brown with a filmy head that dissipated quicky but formed good lacing.  Aroma is a blast of banana mixed with sour chocolate, sourdough bread, some plum, and cereal grains.  The flavour is surprisingly toasty with pumpernickel and banana and pear notes.  Very subtle bitterness yet very sweet.  Medium body and medium carbonation.  I would like this beer if it were a bit drier and way more carbonated.

Cloudy copper with lasting, frothy, off-white head - damp and earth aroma, clove and other spices and a mild tartness - grainy and bready, with just a hint of sweetness - some slight fruitiness and yeastiness - quite subtle but extremely flavorful - dry, somewhat tart finish - well-rounded.

bottle-pours a cloudy dark orange hue with a foamy off-white head.  in the direct light, the beer has an orange hue, but in normal lighting, it looks murky brown, like a cider.  aroma of banana, clove, wheat esters, bubblegum, sourness, and has belgian characteristics?  hmmmmmm  Flavors are bready, yeasty with lots of spice and banana undertones.  As my budy would say (McKinzzle69), it has a "hot garbage" quality.  Body is medium with mild carbonation for this style (a good thing!)  A pretty cool brew.
A very fine Dunkel Weiss, and one that commands respect. Ensure that the brew is served slightly cool, but NOT cold to get the most flavour out of this pint.

Very hazy orange-brown with a tan head that sticks around.  Very nice complex aroma of bananas, yeast and some floral notes.  Bananas in the palate along with a nice sweetness that totally melts away in a totally dry finish.  Great stuff.
bottle. very hazy orangish brown, extremely large head, laced well. initially a sweet apricot flavor followed with a bitter finish. great looking and great tasting.
Pour is hazy brown with a nice fluffy tan head...smell is heavy of banana, cloves, and nutmeg...taste is all banana and clove...bitter finish...

Pint bottle. Cloudy light brown with a thick pale butterscotch colored head that leaves nice lacing as it subsides. Nose: cloves , wheatena cereal , pumpernickel bread,  banana, nutmeg . Flavor is mostly clove and banana , though with traces of, of all things, cauliflower.  Lively carbonation. The aftertaste is reminiscent of wheat toast.  Quite enjoyable.

Big beige foamy head atop a clear dark brown body.  Aroma is not especially strong, but is medium sweet, clove, some banana.  Taste is moderately sweet, banana, clove, some caramel.  Light lemon in the aftertaste.  Watery, lightly carbonated, light body.

Thanks to BeerBlockaid for bringing this one to my attention.  Pint bottle.   Hazy golden brown with nice white head.  Pleasant sweet malt and banana aroma.  Light citrus tartness and yeasty character. Smooth and easy to drink, not bitter at all, somewhat dry wheaty finish.  I like it.

Nice thick white head. Hazy goldish/brown. Roasted hints of banana and semi bitter sweet. some spices. sprit of citrus in there. I really enjoed this. Nice aftertaste and very smooth...almost TOOO easy to drink.

Hazy brown body with a small light tan ring of a head. Aroma is dark roasted bread medium sweet (banana) and light spice. The flavor has much more banana than the aroma, also light bread and hints of sweet caramel. Medium very soft body. Decent stuff, just not outstanding.
Thick Head. Dark and wonderfull. Strong fig/date flavor. Very bitter sweet. Brown sugar after taste. Thick on the tounge. Nice beer.

FINAL QUEST BEER! woohoo! i feel so pround to finally be knighted my my university pub... bottle. monster head... a process just to pour it all out... aroma whety/banana/citrus... sweet and light tasting... me likey... not a bad choice to save for last.
(Bottle)  Pours a lightly cloudy brown body with an average-sized off-white head.  Aroma of sweet malt, molasses, and mustiness.  Floavor of sweet malt and spices.
Tastes & smells heavily malted. Overall its pretty smooth & drinkable. Doubt Id by another one but am glad I tried it.
Mammoth sized tan head, good hang time and lacing. Hazy brown color. Light bananna/ clove nose, dusty. Med/light body. Hints of chocolate, bananna and yeast, all sorta thin though. Fairly dry finish.
Probably the best dunkel Ive had so far, but then again Ive only tried about four.  Still, this is probably the best of those four.  Split the bottle with my roommate and he agrees, delicious
A very good tasting beer.  Very dark with a smooth finish.  Overall a very good beer.

Bottle. Pretty smooth, typical dunkel-weiss. This one is salty, banana esters and clove, with a slight hint of brown sugar. A little bit tart and sweet, but i didnt mind it, wheaty finish, yeasty. No real complaints, definitely not over the top in any way, a nice brew.

Cloudy brown color,large off white head that had a nice long hangtime then faded to a nice lace.Nice wheat and bannana aroma maybe a little spice  as well.Nice wheat malt flavor with a slight bannana and spice some hops and just all around good flavor.Easy to drink and quite pleasant in fact with the heavier carbonation.Thanks go to Shadey for sending this brew my way.
Light brown color with a tall tan fluffy head. Heavy malt and light clove aromas. Flavors of caramel and plae malt with a hint of wheat sweetness. A decent but next echelon dunkelweizen.

Clouded copper body with a huge creamy brown head. Aroma is bubblegum, spice, banana and wheat. Splashes of yeast abound as well. Taste is wonderful! Wheat, spice, fruit, and yeast. Clove and bananas stand out while the yeast comes in towards the end. The malt and wheat bulk the rest of the beer up. Mouthfeel is full and round with medium carbonation and spice. Finish is more spice and sweetened malt with bubblegum. Great beer!

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2007 Tap.  Moderate aroma of primarily peach and malt.  Nice medium brown cloudy appearance - exactly what I expect from a Dunkel.  Flavor is exceptional - peach and malt flavor well blended without either being overpowering.  One of the best when fresh.

Bottle. Very rusty orange with a thick foamy head. Nose is strong-malt , clove, and banana. Typical hefe taste-banana and such. But, this is much more spicy than I am used to in a hefe.  Some black pepper and anise come out.  This is a very thick and chewy beer. The flavor is complex and hard to describe. The finish is very sharp with a good wallop of carbonation.  This is nice, I would have it again, and I dont usually like wheat beers.

This is a hazy tea colored brown beer with a huge creamy head. 
Aroma has some clove, a little banana, but not as much as some others.
The flavor is sweet with a touch of sourness from the wheat, fruity with a creamy full mouth feel. Average stuff.

Bottle. hazy brown pour with a massive head. yeasty fruit aroma. slight acidity to this, but overall flavor is plum and malt. spicy finish. really refreshing. this has lifted my spirits after an arduos drive from san antonio.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2007 Malty aroma.  Yeasty, spicy, malty flavor.  Huge head.  Refreshing with nothing offensive in the flavor.  A good summer brew. 6/5/5/4/15

RERATE: 16oz bottle. Pour is a muddy orange-brown with a big fluffy white head of tight bubbles. Aroma has plenty of banana and clove. Almost like a creamsickle.  Nice malty flavor. Smooth creamy body. Delicious. 6/4/8/4/15
This is a good Dunkelweizen. Yeasty, peppery, and malty flavors.  Finishes clean, crisp, and dry.

Bottle. I was taken by surprise by the extreme foaminess of this beer. One of the lighter looking dunkels. Yeasty aroma.Interesting wheat/citrus taste with a slightly sour finish. Theres also bananas and cloves in there. Smooth and full on the palate. Nice dunkel, could drink lots of it.
Slightly cloudy brown, big dense, finely bubbled head. Aroma of rye bread. Spicy, flowery flavor. Crisp, & mellow, with a rye flavor. Kinda watery.

Pours a hazy brown, with a billowing creamy beige head.  Aroma of yeast, apple and banana.  Creamy, smooth mouthfeel.  Medium bodied.  Wheat and yeast are the dominant flavors, with more banana, clove and some spice.  Short and crisp finish.  One of the better beers of this style.

Enormous creamy head and light lacing. Spicy yeast aroma. Dirty orange brown. Light peppery spice bite builds on the tongue. Spice prescence builds nicely in the back of the mouth with each drink. Soft palate.

Reddish brown and appropriately cloudy. The healthy, small-bubbled carbonation throws up a dense and creamy putty head that any nitro-dispensed stout would envy. Soft impressions of banana bread in the nose, plus coconut, cinnamon, and vanilla. Flavors of yeast, rye or pumpernickel bread, and a fruity sourness reminiscent of lemons or sour cherries, plus faint spicy notes of clove and garam masala. Theres also a whipser of...cocoa puffs cereal? Pleasantly creamy palate. Finishes clean and tart, like berry skins. I can imagine this with weisswurst or spicy Thai food.
Bottle at Andys. Cloudy brownish in color. Malty flavors. Clove and banana. Good beer. Big flavor. Very rich.
Bottle. Cloudy brownish yellow. White head. Malty/phenoloic/clove and banana aroma. Flavor is big and malty, and very rich. This is a malt lovers wheat, for sure.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Big yeast & fruit nose.  Deep clear golden brown.  Large puffy beige head.  Dark fruity malts, toasted grains, cola, clovey graham crackers, delicate and delicious.  Nice body, well balanced, highly drinkable.  I love those Germans...

500mL bottle, 04.28.04.  Pours a murky, dull, canned iced tea with a medium, lingering head.  Aromas of yeast, and bananas, and five-spice, and yeast.  Flavors are pretty mild, even for a hefeweizen (I thought dunkel meant it would be robust?).  There is a touch more backbone to the spice and banananana notes, perhaps bolstered by the sweet nuttiness of the roasted malts.  The finish is wet, sweet, quenching.  A very nice beer, good for a session, enough beer to handle most meals, too.

Nose that you'd expect from a german yeast.  Dark cloudy appearence, with a rather large white head.  Looks pretty.  Tastes sweet with yeast dominance.  Not a big wheat beer fan, but this beer wasn't bad.

Initially ver excited by aroma (beeb a while since I've had a weiss) but over the course of drinking it diminished. Not a bad beer by any stroke, but while being good or very good, it didn't seem to lend anything that placed it above or even next to some others.
Deep brownish color with a giant head. Spice and banana in the aroma. Flavor was weak but plesant. A good beer with a reasonable pricetag.

Bottle, brown with a gigantic off white foamy head. Sweet yeasty aroma with hints of wine and bubble gum. Flavor is more sweet than average hefeweizen, lots of bubble gum, hint of smoke, medium body, quick somewhat dry finish, soft feel. I just don't like dunkelweizens as much as their standard counterparts, but this is still a good beer.

Bottle. To me something about the flavor of this beer seemed to be off. It just didn't seem to quite fit the bill. It poured a huge ivory head that was creamy and smooth with fine-medium sized bubbles that mostly diminished. The body was clear and carbonated with a reddish-brown hue. The nose was malty, caramel, spicy and clove. The flavor was spicy and of clove with a smooth mouthfeel. This was a medium bodied beer with no lacing.

This bottled brew poured a very large sized head of foamy fine to large sized off white colored bubbles that left behind an excellent lace.  The body was softly carbonated transparent brown colored.  The aroma was mild with yeasty malty notes and a hint of orange blossom.  The mouth feel was smooth from start to finish.  The palate was foamy and the flavor was yeasty doughy and had a mild fruity note to it.

Pours slightly dark and murky with a big fluffy head, the appearance is very cloudy.  The aroma is full and fruity.  The flavor is spicy and yeasty, with lots of cloves and banana.  This is one to sip and appreciate.

Bottled.
Hazy, dark amber.
A yeasty aroma with clove and banana.
Smooth and fruity with a spicy and yeasty flavour.

Bottled. 
Murky dark orange. Banana and clove aroma and flavour with a sourish background. Hm...I tend to enjoy weize...

Pours a cloudy brown with a massive head. Aroma is of citrus fruit and bread. Flavor is sour with some wheat and citrus fruit. Quite a different take on the style from what I have experienced. A good beer heya!
Bottle 4.9%. Big white rocky head on top of light brown body. Light malty yeasty flavor with sweet alcohol finish.
Large frothy white head. Deep ruby pour, kind of cloudy. Aroma full of apples and yeast. Nice balanced flavor. Yeasty and wheat dominate the flavor. A pretty decent "dark" Hefe.

Murky, copper lager. Large, rocky, off-white head. Very good retention. the aroma is of apple butter, toffee, coriander and yeast.
Perfectly balanced flavor. Dried plum, molasses, bubblegum and whole grain dough. Medium-bodied with an astringent mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, crisp, dry finish.
Bottled. Nothing special with this one. Didn't have enough of a hefe bit to it. A little to malty for the style for me.

Absolutely terrific!  Massive yeasty aroma wafts from the glass.  Lasting beige head.  Mild hints of sourness (just slight ones) add complexity to a malty yet mildly delicious hefe.  Extremely yeasty in the German style.  Fantastic!

Caramel and cloudy hue (typical of the style).  Some banana in aroma - excellent head retention.  A solid, if not outstanding representation of the style.  Enjoyable, but not in the same class as Schneider Aventinus.
The typical aspects of a hefe are here, but it seemed to have a darker twinge to it.  Maybe it's just me, i dunno.
first sip is watery.. the flavor starts to go toward malty and some clove taste as it warms up.  the initial appearance and aroma are good.. with a solid head.  Just not my favorite style
Thin bodied. Some flavours lurking around, sort of banana and cola. Spicy, peppery, slightly clove like aroma. Some sweetness. Drinkable, but not exciting.

Mohogany color with a thick tan head and a subtle yeasty aroma.  Body starts thick, lightly caramely with good carbonation throughout.  Some mild hoppy notes, but mostly dominated but toffee-like malt flavors.  Smooth and enjoyable.

A hazy brown colour with a very dense (3 centimetres thick) tan head. Smells of disgusting canned corn, a bit of wheat, and caster sugar are all prominent. Taste which is very sweet, a bit wheaty and definately remiminiscent of that damn canned corn. As I drink more and more...the taste gets a bit better...definately more sweet, but still equally as refreshing. The aftertaste is sweet from the residual sugar that wasn't turned into alcohol. A definately interesting beer...and pretty good actually with all things considered. I got this bottle in a beer trade with great guy and great trader Matt A. (Mabdoney) from Florida. Thanks again!

Deny me not, this beer smells and tastes like circus peanuts.  Pours a cloudy red/brown with an off-white head.  Possesses a yeasty, estery aroma.  Flavor is circus peanuts (you know, those orange sugary monstrosities), with banana and wheat flavors striking the palate.  An interesting brew.
malty, slightly sweet smell; dark, cloudy color with a creamy light-brown head; medium bodied; slightly sweet taste, but with a slightly sour finish

Note to self: Don't forget how much you like dark wheat beers.
Nearly as dark as coca-cola and cloudy with a massive rocky head atop. Aroma is big and beautiful, clove, wheat malt and and a slight nutty aroma. Beer has a highly effervescent crispness to it and a medium to full body. Terrific flavors of spicy grainy malts are delicious. One of the better Dunkelweiss biers.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: Wonderful banana aroma.  The body is quite bland and incomplete.  It has a decent wheat flavor but not much else.  Finishes in much the same way.  Not a very good example of the style.
Has a dark clouded brown color with a lot of carbonation and a roasted/spice/fruit smell.  Taste is fruit/spice/wheat and finishes slightly sour.  Overall a good dark wheat, but not the best.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2003 This Julius Echter -Dunkel is unreal. It poured the most amazing head that I have ever seen; it was so dense that I wrote my name in it. The aroma is of walnut, toffee, and banana; the taste was refreshing and light. I cant imagine a better Dunkel, but I will keep hunting just to be certain.
Nuddy deep brown. Huge, fluffy, rocky head- great lace. Nose of asparagus and bananas. Slightly sharp mouthfeel- good thing. Effervescent.
A nice weiss beer.  Reminds me of bananas (much like Weihenstephaner).  Nice dark color, easy to drink.
Nice spicy banana, faint in the nose but increases in the taste. A hint of clove. Slightly sweet banana finish.
A good weiss. Dark mahogany color of rotting apples and smells of that to. Lightly cloudy, a bit too light. Tastes strongly of cider.
Nicely sweet and fruity chesnut colored weiss. Medium bodied with a pleasant aftertaste. Smooth and balanced, a good choice to have again.
Good lookng dark wheat.  Flavours consist of banana, spices and a hint of chocolate.  This foams in the mouth followed by a long finish.  Very good.

Quite a nice surprise compared to their regular weiss.  Deep brown body with a light tan fluffy head. The flavors were full of spices, banana and chocolate.  The only complaint I have is that its on the thin side
Not bad at all.  But I need to have more to really pin down the flavors and aromas on this one.  Because I drank only one of these a long time ago.

Pours a cloudy brown color with a big, long lasting, off-white head. Nice aroma of yeast, malts, and banana. Malty sweet taste with bananas and other fruity flavors on the palate. Medium bodied with a nice lingering sweet aftertaste. Very smooth and drinkable. A nice Dunkel.

Slightly clody copper/red. Thin but lasting head and sticky lace. Nose of cloves, banana, malt, minerals, spices and others. Smooth, almost medium bodied, yeasty fruitines, banana on the palate, clean on the backend, refreshing and balanced. A good Dunkel.

Classic weiss aroma, very dark reddish brown color, not as an impressive pour as the regular hefe weiss. Overcarbonation ruins the palate. Everything is good with this until it comes to the palate, which almost ruins the beer.

Impressive look! Very thick head contrasted in great way with brownish / amber color. Fruity aroma banana, citric with bitter English ale mix. Winner of tonight rating session with my bro at my 25th b-day!

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2007 Rerate Dark ruby red pour, extremely thick off-white head. Fresh clove and bubblegum aroma. Sweet, but not cloying banana-like flavor with some candied sugar notes. Thick enough mouthfeel. Overall solidOriginal 3.8  Full bodied fruity wheat.  Bit too sweet to make it a regular selection - but not a bad ale for the summer.

Rich head and deep roasty golden color and slightly hazy, with a firm sticky head. Medium full aroma of banana, clove and lighter fruit esters. You might say the Dunkle Weiss is a deep malty form of the Bavaraian hefe weiss and this one is a delicious example if on the slightly thin side. I like them crisp and this is just off-crisp. This got an audible wow out of me.

Deep, clear and dark with tall slightly buff head.  Not much aroma.  Flavor was somewhat sour and reminded me of cola. The Dunkel didnt compare favorably with the plain old Hefe-Weiss from Echter.  The brew had an unpleasantly tart/metallic finish which rather ruined the beer for me.
I noticed the wispered hint of citrus as well.
Looks darn pretty, a brownish-amber with a large, creamy head.  Scent is lemony.  Flavor is very much like a wit, very spicy with plenty of citrus and lemon in the background.
A fine Dunkelweizen, given extra points for having been the first beer I bought when I turned 21 several years ago.
Second time Ive tried this and I still cant get used to the almost salty taste on the palate.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2006 Pint bottle:  Hazy dark orange with a thick off-white head, aroma has banana, cherries and rich yeast, full bodied for the style with a wonderful creamy texture, starts and ends lightly sweet with a long lightly sweet ending.  A true classic.
Nice malts indeed, but the finish bothered too much.
Very true to style dunkle weiss.Nice malt and weiss spice.
A bit dry in the finish but quite tasty.

A well constructed Dunkle Weiss. Amber color; very carbonated to style; attractive clove, banana, vanilla aroma; nice caramel malt flavor with some mellow spiciness; finishes slightly medicinal or astringent, but overall a solid beer and worth a try.
